New Records: LeBron James and Bronny James became the first father and son to play in the NBA together during the Los Angeles Lakers' season opener against the Minnesota Timberwolves on October 22, 2024.
Key Match Events: LeBron and Bronny checked into the game together with four minutes left in the second quarter, prompting a big ovation from the home crowd.
LeBron missed two perimeter shots before making a dunk.
Bronny had an early rebound and missed a tip-in.
Bronny's first NBA jump shot was a 3-pointer that came up just short.
Pre-Game Insights: LeBron James first spoke about his dream to play alongside Bronny a few years ago, while his oldest son was still in high school.
The Lakers were fully aware of the history they would make with this pairing, and coach JJ Redick spoke with the Jameses recently about a plan to make it happen early in the regular season.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed pride in his son's effort and the historic moment they shared on the court.
Miami forward Kevin Love commented on the significance of the moment, saying it was 'an unbelievable moment' to see father and son playing together.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ken Griffey Sr. and Ken Griffey Jr. were courtside at the Lakers' downtown arena to witness the same history they made in Major League Baseball.
LeBron James shows no signs of slowing down as he begins his NBA record-tying 22nd season.
Others: Bronny James survived cardiac arrest and open heart surgery in the summer of 2023 and went on to play a truncated freshman season at the University of Southern California.
LeBron spent the summer in Europe with the gold medal-winning US team at the Paris Olympics, while Bronny played for the Lakers in the summer league.
